business.headline: Explained: Why EU leaders' India visit matters for the mega trade dealBy linking one of the world's fastest-growing major economies with a bloc that remains a central pillar of global trade, the deal would reshape supply-chain flows at a time when governments are rethinking their economic dependencies.

IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

French President's viral Davos shades give iVision Tech a 38 crore stock boostFrench President Emmanuel Macron's look during his World Economic Forum speech went viral online and the market reacted instantly.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Is Rs 50,000 salary enough to invest? Sebi advisor explains what actually worksFinancial advisors say this income level is enough to begin building a long-term portfolio, provided the focus remains on discipline, safety and clear financial goals.

IndiGo share price down 4% after Q3 results: Buy, sell or hold?IndiGo share price: The stock slipped as much as 3.9% during early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 4,723.60. It later recovered part of the losses but continued to trade in the red.

Gold and silver hit new highs again. Should you still buy?While the domestic trend remains sharply bullish, experts say understanding the broader backdrop can help investors think about why the rally is persisting and what it could mean for portfolios this year.

Infosys to hire 20,000 graduates in FY27 as AI demand surges: ReportInfosys is gearing up for heavier AI workloads in 2026 and beyond, and the scale of its campus hiring shows where the company believes client spending is beginning to stabilise and grow.
Sensex, Nifty open in green over improved global cues; TCS up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 77.47 points to 82,384.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.95 points to 25,321.85 as of 9:24 am.

8th Pay Commission: Employee bodies to meet soon to finalise salary hike demandsThe meeting will be held under the banner of the National Council (Staff Side) of the Joint Consultative Machinery, which represents central government employees in discussions with the government.

Shadowfax IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status and listing gainsInvestors who applied for Shadowfax IPO can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the portal of KFin Technologies Limited, which is the official registrar for the issue.

entertainment.headline: Dissent is patriotic: Nayanthara's fierce first look from Mammootty's Patriot out The makers of Patriot have released the first look poster of Nayanthara. It showcases her in a serious avatar alongside the tagline 'Dissent is patriotic'. The film, directed by Mahesh Narayanan, features a star-studded cast and is slated for release in 2026.

Oscars under fire: Natalie Portman calls out snub of women-directed films Natalie Portman spoke out against the Academy for the lack of recognition for women-directed films in the latest Oscar nominations. She was speaking out at Sundance during her film The Gallerist premiere.

Hrithik Roshan attends Goldie Behl's birthday bash on crutches, no photo-op Actor Hrithik Roshan attended Goldie Behl's birthday celebration while walking on crutches. The actor avoided posing for paparazzi, sparking concern and curiosity among fans.

False and outrageous: Palaash serves Rs 10 crore defamation notice to Sangli man Music composer Palaash Muchhal has initiated legal action against Sangli-based actor-producer Vidnyan Mane. The move came following allegations of financial fraud related to a film investment and cheating accusations involving cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Why Sunny Deol's superstardom is unique: Betaab to Border 2 via Ghayal and Gadar Sunny Deol's ability to return with the right film at the right time lets him tide over stretches of forgettable releases. Border 2 is the latest instance.

Border 2 box office day 2: Sunny Deol film dominates Republic Day weekend Sunny Deol's Border 2 performed better than Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar on its second day at the box office. The film is solidifying its status as the biggest tentpole release of 2026 so far.

When 'It Ends With Us' didn't end: Timeline of the Blake Lively–Justin Baldoni row It Ends With Us was expected to charm audiences, instead the film's release sparked a bitter legal battle between its lead stars, Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni, dragging Taylor Swift into the spotlight. As the case keeps resurfacing, here's a look at how and when events unfolded.

Seema Sajdeh breaks silence on Sohail Khan divorce: Better separated than fighting Seema Sajdeh reflected on her separation from Sohail Khan, outlining the circumstances of their divorce, its emotional impact on their family, and her journey towards practical independence.

Ranbir Kapoor's fat suit look in Animal still has fans doing a double take A recently resurfaced behind-the-scenes video showcases the intricate prosthetics work behind Ranbir Kapoor's physical transformation in the 2023 film Animal, highlighting the actor's evolving career and fans' reactions to his convincing appearance.

Ram Gopal Varma shuts down AR Rahman's communal claim: Cinema runs on money Film director Ram Gopal Varma and singer Sona Mohapatra respond to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in the Hindi film industry, stating that commercial viability remains the key driver of Bollywood's choices.

Soft launch of forever? Athiya Shetty's 'Happy Three' post melts the internet Bollywood actor Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul marked their third wedding anniversary by sharing heartfelt moments on Instagram, drawing warm reactions from fans, friends and family.

Japanese fan speaks perfect Telugu, leaves Allu Arjun and Rashmika shocked During a promotional event for Pushpa 2: The Rule in Japan, actors Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna were taken aback when a Japanese fan, Kazu, spoke fluent Telugu and praised their performances.

Disgusted and humiliated: Mouni Roy calls out stage harassment in Haryana Actor Mouni Roy has publicly detailed an incident of harassment she experienced at a recent event in Karnal, expressing her distress and urging authorities to respond.

Linkin Park's Emily Armstrong wears Assamese Gamusa during India debut. Watch Linkin Park's first India concert in Bengaluru saw new vocalist Emily Armstrong wearing a traditional Assamese gamusa during their performance of Faint, drawing significant attention online and prompting discussions about cultural appreciation.

Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's Haq tops Netflix charts in Pakistan and Nigeria Actors Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's Haq has sparked significant discussion in Pakistan and Nigeria. Viewers and public figures in both countries are reacting strongly to its themes of faith, law, marriage, and women's rights.

Shah Rukh Khan's King release date announced: Check details Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film King is set for a December 2026 release. The Siddharth Anand directorial marks their much-anticipated reunion.

Mona Singh thanks fans as Border 2 earns strong audience praise Mona Singh has garnered significant appreciation following the release of Border 2, as audiences and critics highlight her impactful performance.

Battle of Galwan song Maatrubhoomi: Salman Khan strikes a patriotic chord Maatrubhumi, the first song from the upcoming war drama Battle of Galwan, has been released ahead of Republic Day. Featuring Salman Khan, the track honours the nation and its soldiers. The song features vocals by Arijit Singh, Shreya Ghoshal and Master Mani Dharamkot

Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, daughter booked for alleged fraud of Rs 13.5 crore A businessman has accused filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his daughter, Krishna Bhatt, of defrauding him of Rs 13.5 crore through false promises of investment returns. The Economic Offences Wing has taken over the investigation.

general news.headline: Another Hindu man burned alive in Bangladesh, family calls it planned murderPolice have seized evidence and CCTV footage from the site as the victim's family alleged the garage fire was a planned killing and demanded immediate arrests of those involved.

What did you do: Chilling video captures moment agents shot Minneapolis manOne of the videos, shot by a woman, shows that during an anti-immigration drive in Minneapolis, at least six ICE officials dragged Pretti to the ground and fired shots while trying to apprehend him.

ICC warns Pakistan of severe sanctions over T20 World Cup boycott drama: SourcesThe ICC has warned Pakistan of unprecedented sanctions if it pulls out of the T20 World Cup. Sources say a boycott could cripple the PCB financially and isolate Pakistan from global cricket.

Torn from families, Indians now see H-1B interview dates pushed to 2027H-1B visa interview dates have once again been delayed, with many applicants seeing their appointments pushed to 2027. The delays stem from a shortage of new interview slots, leaving thousands of professionals stranded in India, separated from their jobs and families while awaiting visa processing.

If 40 is the new layoff age, is it also India's new retirement age?The new middle-class nightmare isn't recession but redundancy at 40. It takes one call, one email, one "restructuring", and your peak earning years are wiped out. It is true, India is creating a 20-year gap where people are neither employed nor retired, just stuck in survival mode.

Professor stabbed to death in Mumbai local after altercation with co-passengerThe incident took place when the train was entering the Malad station, which the victim's destination. The attacker managed to flee the scene as the train was coming to a halt.

Bangladesh accepts ICC's T20 World Cup axe, won't challenge decision furtherThe Bangladesh Cricket Board has accepted the ICC's decision to drop them from the T20 World Cup 2026 after refusing to travel to India. The BCB said there was nothing more they could do.

Who was Alex Jeffrey Pretti, 37-year-old Minneapolis man fatally shot by ICE agents?Born in Illinois, Pretti was an intensive care unit nurse who used to work at the city's VA hospital. He was a staunch critic of the Trump administration's anti-immigration crackdown policies.

Why Sunny Deol's superstardom is unique: Betaab to Border 2 via Ghayal and GadarHandcrafted ByOur Editors Sunny Deol's ability to return with the right film at the right time lets him tide over stretches of forgettable releases. Border 2 is the latest instance.

Sickening lies: Family of Minneapolis shooting victim hits out at TrumpThe killing has fuelled anger in Minneapolis, with the victim's family rejecting federal claims and pressing for an independent investigation into the actions of immigration agents.

Tasked to destroy Laluism: Rohini Acharya's cryptic post ahead of key RJD meetRohini Acharya's post comes months after Rashtriya Janata Dal's crushing defeat in Bihar Assembly elections, following which she quit politics and blamed Tejashwi Yadav's and his aides for the party's collapse.

Tamil Nadu govt caps private school fees: Parents to get relief under new billThe Tamil Nadu government has moved to regulate private school fees, aiming to prevent sudden hikes. Parents can expect more transparency and stability in fee structures once the amendment is implemented.

When 'It Ends With Us' didn't end: Timeline of the Blake Lively–Justin Baldoni rowIt Ends With Us was expected to charm audiences, instead the film's release sparked a bitter legal battle between its lead stars, Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni, dragging Taylor Swift into the spotlight. As the case keeps resurfacing, here's a look at how and when events unfolded.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Indian Army, UP govt help late Army officer's daughter reclaim ancestral homeThe Indian Army and Uttar Pradesh government coordinated with civil authorities to help the daughter of a late Territorial Army officer legally reclaim her ancestral home in Lucknow.

Monster winter storm grips US, over 13,000 flights cancelledEmergency crews were deployed as power outages and travel disruptions spread across multiple storm-battered states. Forecasters said prolonged cold would slow repairs even as officials worked to reopen roads and airports.

I am losing body fat, but my weight is not changing. Here's what is happeningI joined a gym in October hoping the scale would fall. Three months, one and a half hours a day, six days a week later, my clothes were looser and my body fat had dropped, but the weighing machine stubbornly read 53 kg. I wanted to know why the mirror and the machine were telling different stories.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Asia dominates THE global university rankings. So why is India still missing?THE Subject Rankings 2026 reveal a stark gap between India and Asia's top universities. While China, Singapore, Hong Kong, Japan and South Korea dominate the global top 100 across disciplines, India features just once. A closer look shows what Asian higher education systems are doing right, and what India is not.

Where did Earth's water come from? Secret hidden on the MoonNasa researchers studying Apollo-era lunar soil discovered that meteorites from the Moon provided only a small fraction of Earth's water. This groundbreaking study challenges the popular theory that space rocks filled our vast oceans.

Have you seen the viral Nihilist Penguin video? Here's why the internet is hookedA lone penguin's inland walk from a Werner Herzog documentary has now become a viral meme, as it symbolises modern emotional struggles and isolation.

Border 2 box office day 2: Sunny Deol film dominates Republic Day weekendSunny Deol's Border 2 performed better than Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar on its second day at the box office. The film is solidifying its status as the biggest tentpole release of 2026 so far.

Scotland reacts to surprise T20 World Cup opportunity, confirm immediate travel plansScotland have confirmed immediate travel plans to India after replacing Bangladesh at the T20 World Cup 2026. Cricket Scotland thanked the ICC in a special letter while accepting the invitation under unique circumstances.

sports.headline: ICC warns Pakistan of severe sanctions over T20 World Cup boycott drama: Sources The ICC has warned Pakistan of unprecedented sanctions if it pulls out of the T20 World Cup. Sources say a boycott could cripple the PCB financially and isolate Pakistan from global cricket.

How Jadeja's advice led to Shubman Gill's downfall against Saurashtra spinner Parth Bhut credited Ravindra Jadeja for his aggressive bowling that dismissed Shubman Gill twice in the Ranji Trophy. Bhut's performance led Saurashtra to a commanding win as he scalped ten wickets in the match.

IPL 2026: CSK suffer big blow as Rs 14.2 crore recruit left seriously injured CSK's ₹14.20 crore recruit Prashant Veer has suffered a shoulder injury ahead of IPL 2026. This setback could impact CSK's season plans after Jadeja's trade to Rajasthan Royals.

Suryakumar Yadav back in beast mode: Is India's T20 crown safe again? Suryakumar Yadav is back in form at the right time with India aiming to defend their T20 World Cup crown. With the captain back amongst the runs, SKY offers a new dimension to India's already destructive batting order.

Bangladesh accepts ICC's T20 World Cup axe, won't challenge decision further The Bangladesh Cricket Board has accepted the ICC's decision to drop them from the T20 World Cup 2026 after refusing to travel to India. The BCB said there was nothing more they could do.

Scotland reacts to surprise T20 World Cup opportunity, confirm immediate travel plans Scotland have confirmed immediate travel plans to India after replacing Bangladesh at the T20 World Cup 2026. Cricket Scotland thanked the ICC in a special letter while accepting the invitation under unique circumstances.

Kylian Mbappe dedicates panenka penalty to Real Madrid teammate in Villarreal win Kylian Mbappe sealed Real Madrid's 2-0 win over Villarreal with a Panenka penalty in stoppage time. The French star dedicated the goal to Brahim Diaz, who faced heavy criticism after missing a Panenka in the AFCON final.

In-form India eye another series win, but can supporting crew step up? India vs New Zealand 3rd T20I preview: The Indian team are aiming to secure another T20I series under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy, but there are a few players who are yet to step up for the hosts.

IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson running out of time with his role as opener under review IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I: Sanju Samson faces growing pressure ahead of the third T20I against New Zealand as poor returns, Ishan Kishan's form and Tilak Varma's return threaten his place in India's World Cup plans.

AUS Open 2026, Day 8 Live: Alcaraz, Sabalanka advance to quarter-finals Australian Open 2026, Day 8 Live: Spanish world No. 1 Carlos Alcaraz has advaced to the quarter finals with straight sets victory over Tommy Paul. Earlier, Aryna Sabalenka sealed her quarter-final spot with a win over Victoria Mboko.

Bangladesh cricket board opens door for Shakib Al Hasan's comeback BCB have retained Shakib Al Hasan in their central contract list and reopened the door for his international return, as the veteran all-rounder reveals plans to retire at home after one final series.

SL vs ENG: All-round Joe Root brilliance helps England draw series levelJoe Root starred with bat and ball as England beat Sri Lanka by five wickets in Colombo to level the ODI series ahead of the decider.

Bangladesh's T20 WC boycott a government call, we wanted to play: Board directorBangladesh's T20 World Cup boycott was a government call, according to board director Amjad Hossain. The BCB official said that Bangladesh did want to be a part of the tournament but had to abide by the directive from the government.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru's unbeaten run ends after horror-show vs Delhi CapitalsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru's five-match winning streak ended in stunning fashion as Delhi Capitals produced a dominant bowling display and chased down a modest target to seal a crushing WPL victory.

IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I Predicted XI: Will India experiment with Ishan Kishan as opener?IND vs NZ, 3rd T20I Predicted XI: Ishan Kishan's blistering knock has reopened India's opener debate ahead of the third T20I against New Zealand. Will Gautam Gambhir persist with Sanju Samson or make a late experiment at the top?

Who replaces Pakistan if they boycott T20 World Cup 2026 like Bangladesh?Following Bangladesh's boycott of the T20 World Cup 2026, Pakistan's participation in the tournament remains under a cloud. Bangladesh were replaced by Scotland on Saturday, January 24.

The chain of events that led Bangladesh out of T20 World Cup 2026From Mustafizur Rahman's IPL removal to Bangladesh's dramatic exit from the 2026 T20 World Cup, a political storm, security fears and ICC ultimatums reshaped the tournament in just three weeks.

After Bangladesh's ugly T20 World Cup snub, BCB director steps downOn the very day when Bangladesh were left out of the T20 World Cup with Scotland replacing them for the tournament, BCB director Ishtiaque Sadeque stepped down as the director.

Novak Djokovic apologises for ballgirl incident: Sorry for causing any distressNovak Djokovic apologised after a frustrated shot narrowly missed a ballgirl during his Australian Open third-round win, escaping punishment despite echoes of his 2020 US Open default.

Why Bangladesh was replaced by Scotland in T20 World Cup? ICC explains decisionThe International Cricket Council (ICC) explained the reasons behind their call to replace Bangladesh from the T20 World Cup 2026 and name Scotland as their replacement on Saturday, January 24.

Ayush Mhatre returns to form as dominant India U19 storm into Super 6 unbeatenU19 World Cup, IND vs NZ: India beat New Zealand by seven wickets via DLS after chasing down a revised target of 130 in 13.3 overs. They also ended the league stage unbeaten with wins in all three games.

Baby steps: Out with injury, Pratika Rawal grinds it out in gym after Test call-upPratika Rawal shared a video of herself training intensively in the gym as she prepares for her international comeback, following her selection for India's upcoming Test against Australia.
Pakistan to pull out of T20 World Cup? Mohsin Naqvi reponds to Bangladesh exitPCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi said that Pakistan's participation in the T20 World Cup will depend on the government's call.

Novak Djokovic escapes punishment after shot in anger nearly hits ballgirl: WatchNovak Djokovic escaped sanction after a ball struck in frustration narrowly missed a ballgirl during his third-round win at the Australian Open, before he went on to seal victory and a historic 400th Grand Slam match win.

Sourav Ganguly's coaching mantra: A friend, a mentor and something moreAhead of the SA20 final, Sourav Ganguly offers rare insight into his coaching philosophy and why being a guide matters more than being in charge.

Wawrinka goes full Stone Cold Steve Austin, exits AUS Open with beer toastStan Wawrinka marked his final Australian Open appearance with a heartfelt farewell, and enjoyed a beer toast in Melbourne as he made his exit from the tournament. Wawrinka played his final match against Taylor Fritz.

Djokovic rewrites history with 400 Grand Slam wins, Swiatek survives huge scareAustralian Open: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic stormed into the fourth round at Melbourne Park after beating Botic van de Zandschulp of the Netherlands 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (4) at the Rod Laver Arena.

Bangladesh officially out of T20 WC, ICC names Scotland as replacementThe ICC informed Bangladesh via a letter on Saturday, January 24 that they have been replaced by Scotland for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, according to sources.

If ICC members support BAN, it won't be Indian Cricket Council: Ex PCB chiefFormer PCB chairman Najam Sethi urges cricketing nations to support Bangladesh amid concerns about the ICC's alleged bias towards India. Bangladesh have pulled out of the T20 World Cup 2026, citing security concerns.

MS Dhoni begins IPL 2026 preparations? CSK icon's Jharkhand nets video goes viralMS Dhoni has sparked fresh IPL 2026 buzz after a Jharkhand nets video went viral. Wearing yellow pads, the CSK icon's early return to batting has fans dreaming of one final title push.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
